alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 12 at 1:04PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Crow Wing zone. .Warm temperatures will melt the snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Fort Ripley. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Flooding of low lying areas adjacent the river is expected At 11.0 feet, This will cause minor flooding of rural areas near Fort Ripley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Saturday afternoon. Additional rises to near 11.5 feet are possible by Tuesday. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Mississippi River Fort Ripley 10.5 7.4 Wed 11 am CD 8.4 9.5 10.4 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening by 715 PM CDT.
